definition: to go up in smoke/to vanish
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu
crow/black
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Don't go for wealth ; even that fades away.
sentences.chinese: 不要追求万贯家产，财富最终也会化为乌有。

sentences.english: Till love and fame to nothingness do sink.
sentences.chinese: 直到爱与虚名化为乌有沉寂无声。

sentences.english: Unless this is reversed, excess supply of surplus countries must also collapse.
sentences.chinese: 除非发生逆转，盈余国家的过度供给也必将化为乌有。

sentences.english: But my tangle of half-truths was all for naught.
sentences.chinese: 但我对半真半假纠纷是所有化为乌有。

sentences.english: He knew that his hope oozed away.
sentences.chinese: 他知道他的希望逐渐化为乌有了。

sentences.english: Unfavorable perception caused the company’s low-cost borrowing to evaporate almost immediately.
sentences.chinese: 不良信誉导致该公司的低成本贷款几乎即刻化为乌有。

sentences.english: All this eats into the potential of the economy to grow.
sentences.chinese: 所有这一切都把经济增长的潜力化为乌有。

sentences.english: When Beckham missed the penalty kick, his team's advantage went down the drain.
sentences.chinese: 贝克汉姆踢飞了点球，球队的优势随即化为乌有。

sentences.english: Putin said that "self-isolation of the country will come to naught."
sentences.chinese: 普京表示，“自我封闭的国家将化为乌有。”

sentences.english: His involvement in the Watergate evaporated any hope Nixon had for a political career.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松同水门丑闻的牵连使他从政的希望化为乌有。

sentences.english: He that bringeth the searchers of secrets to nothing, that hath made the judges of the earth as vanity.
sentences.chinese: 他使王侯化为乌有，叫地上士绅成为虚无。

sentences.english: They lost everything they had accumulated over their 40-year marriage.
sentences.chinese: 他们结婚40年来积累的一切财产全部化为乌有。

sentences.english: After the wave came, the sand castle on the beach lay in ruins .
sentences.chinese: 海浪冲击海岸后，海滩上的沙堡化为乌有。

definition: to come to nothing (idiom)
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
not to exist/nonexistent/illusory
to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to melt like ice and break like tiles/to disintegrate/to dissolve
to collapse/to fall apart
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
wasted effort
lit. froth and shadows/fig. illusion/mirage
nearly exhausted/practically nothing left
in an instant
to eliminate/to obliterate
to dissipate
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
instantly/in no time
